notes.note: This course is closed to non-BCLS majors.  All seats reserved for Medical Technology/Biotechnology program students, as appropriate to their major.

catalog.title: Laboratory Management
catalog.description: Covers managerial theory and practice, resume writing and interviewing, influence of regulatory agencies, and current issues affecting health care. Registration in MT 423 is limited to MT accepted majors only.  Registration in MT 523 is open to graduate students only on a space available basis and with permission of the instructor.
catalog.subject: Medical Technology

notes.note: This course is closed to non-BCLS majors.  All seats reserved for Medical Technology/Biotechnology program students, as appropriate to their major.

catalog.title: Bioseparation Techniques
catalog.description: MT 530/430 introduces the theory and practice of  biochemistry through laboratory experiments designed to provide the student experience with common analytical techniques used to isolate, quantify, and characterize biomolecules.  There is significant emphasis on chromatographic instrumentation. Laboratory practices include multiple bioseparation techniques including thin layer, classical column, high performance liquid, and gas chromatography as well as electrophoretic separation. The laboratory also employs automated and semi-automated chemistry systems.  Registration in MT 530/430 is limited to accepted MS and BS majors of BTE only.  Not open to non-majors.
catalog.subject: Medical Technology

notes.note: This course is closed to non-BCLS majors.  All seats reserved for Medical Technology/Biotechnology program students, as appropriate to their major.

catalog.title: Clinical Chemistry
catalog.description: Clinical Chemistry (also known as chemical pathology, clinical biochemistry or medical biochemistry), is the area of clinical pathology that is generally concerned with analysis of bodily fluids. MT 407/507 lecture will emphasize the physiological theory of disease and the principles of chemistry testing. MT 407/507 laboratory will develop technical competencies in analytical methods and computer-based data reduction and interpretation. Students will study electrolytes, blood gases, hormones, endocrine disorders toxicology of drugs, metabolites, enzymes, etc. Students are required to take both the lecture and the laboratory. Registration in MT 407/507 is limited to MT accepted majors only.
catalog.subject: Medical Technology

notes.note: This course is closed to non-BCLS majors.  All seats reserved for Medical Technology/Biotechnology program students, as appropriate to their major.

catalog.title: Clinical Microbiology Lab
catalog.description: The MT 409/509 laboratory compliments the MT 409/509 lecture. Students in MT 409/509 laboratory will study techniques and methods used to identify and isolate bacterial pathogens. The laboratory consists of microscopic, biochemical and immunological procedures to identify pathogens from clinical specimens. Students are required to take both the lecture and the laboratory in the same semester. Registration in MT 409/509 is limited to MT accepted majors only.
catalog.subject: Medical Technology

notes.note: This course is closed to non-BCLS majors.  All seats reserved for Medical Technology/Biotechnology program students, as appropriate to their major.

catalog.title: Clinical Microbiology
catalog.description: Clinical Microbiology is a comprehensive study of the prevention, diagnosis and treatment of infectious diseases that affect humans. MT 409/509 lecture will present the theory and principles of the study the classification, etiology, pathogenicity, laboratory identification, diagnosis, and treatment of bacterial infections, and will provide an overview of the classification and pathogenicity of viral infections. Students are required to take both the lecture and the laboratory in the same semester. Registration in MT 409/509 is limited to MT accepted majors only.
catalog.subject: Medical Technology

notes.note: This course is closed to non-BCLS majors.  All seats reserved for Medical Technology/Biotechnology program students, as appropriate to their major.
This course is closed to non-BCLS majors.  All seats reserved for Medical Technology/Biotechnology program students, as appropriate to their major.

catalog.title: Biotechnology Journal Club II
catalog.description: In this required course, students will learn, with collaboration of other MS BTE graduate students and under faculty supervision, how to evaluate and present original research from biotechnology, biochemical, biomolecular, genetic, and related topics.  Students will typically present a seminar either describing their proposed thesis/ project research (students in year one of the program) or give a progress report of their ongoing research activities (students in year two of the program).  A brief question and answer session will follow each student presentation, involving students and BCLS faculty.  Students will learn to formulate a seminar abstract, present in a seminar, prepare quality slides, use background information well, and evaluate papers, methods, results and conclusions.  Student presentation will also be evaluated on the student's critical assessment of the presented research, ability to respond to audience questions and extent to which the student places the results in a broader context of ongoing research.
catalog.subject: Medical Technology

notes.note: This course is closed to non-BCLS majors.  All seats reserved for Medical Technology/Biotechnology program students, as appropriate to their major.

catalog.title: Clin Immunohematology
catalog.description: Clinical Immunohematology is frequently referred to as "blood banking." MT 405/535 will present the theory, principles and laboratory skills associated with the human blood group antigens and antibodies, as they relate to the production and development of disease and blood disorders. Students will learn blood typing, cross-matching and antibody identification. Students are required to take both the lecture and the laboratory. Registration in MT 405/535 is limited to MT accepted majors only.
catalog.subject: Medical Technology

notes.note: This course is closed to non-BCLS majors.  All seats reserved for Medical Technology/Biotechnology program students, as appropriate to their major.

catalog.title: App Mol Biotechnology
catalog.description: Discussions of the application of recombinant DNA technology to create various products and to solve problems. Topics include the manipulation of prokaryotic and eukaryotic cells to produce recombinant proteins, directed mutatgenesis/protein engineering, production of therapeutic agents and vaccines, gene therapy, commercial product production by recombinant microorganisms, bioremediation and biomass utilization, genetic engineering of plants, transgenic animals and the regulation and patenting of molecular biotechnology. Registration in MT 537/437 is limited to accepted MS and BS majors of BTE only; on a space available basis, students from other majors who have fulfilled the prerequisites may petition for enrollment.
catalog.subject: Medical Technology

catalog.title: Biotech Career Prep
catalog.description: Explores the various careers in biotechnology with participation by individuals from various biotechnology companies. Discusses career options such as research and development, quality control and quality assurance, regulatory affairs, marketing, management, patent development, and sales. Teaches written skills including preparation of a resume and a curriculum vitae. Oral skills include preparing for and experiencing a simulated interview for an internship, career job position, graduate school, or other experience.  Registration in MT 445 is limited to accepted majors of BTE only. Registration in MT 545 is available on a space available basis and with permission of instructor for MS BTE graduate students.  Not open to non-majors.
catalog.subject: Medical Technology

catalog.title: Int Mic Genome Annotation
catalog.description: Application of the Integrated Microbial Genomics Annotation Collaboration Toolkit (IMG-ACT) to perform annotation of genes in a microbe with a sequenced genome. A series of online modules will be demonstrated by the instructor, followed by student application of the modules to genes assigned to them for analysis. Registration in MT 547/447 is limited to accepted majors of BTE only; on a space available basis, students from other majors who have fulfilled the prerequisites may petition for enrollment.
catalog.subject: Medical Technology

catalog.title: Cell & Tissue Cult Tech Lab
catalog.description: MT 534/434, Cell and Tissue Culture Lab, introduces the concepts of cell and tissue culture, with specific laboratory exercises designed to expose the student, through the use of primary and established cell lines, to sterile technique, media preparation, quality control and cell line validation, passaging of nonadherent and adherent cells, cryopreservation, microscopy and digital photography. Cellular assays for viability, proliferation, invasion, and apoptosis are performed. Registration in MT 534/434 is limited to accepted MS and BS majors of BTE only.
catalog.subject: Medical Technology

notes.note: This course is closed to non-BCLS majors.  All seats reserved for Medical Technology/Biotechnology program students, as appropriate to their major.
